Position 3
==========

Councilmember Trish Hanks
-------------------------

Councilmember Trish Hanks is serving in her second term. She was Mayor Pro Tem from July, 2020 until July 2021.  After a career in education spanning 40 years, Trish retired in 2017 after serving 15 years as the Superintendent of the Friendswood Independent School District. She was a founding member of the Friendswood Education Foundation.  Trish was an educator in many different capacities and was named Distinguished Educator in 2016 by Sam Houston State University.  She continues to be a lifelong learner and has concentrated her learning lately on municipal government, where she received the 2019 Leadership Fellow Award by the Texas Municipal League’s Leadership Development Academy and in 2020 was invited to attend and completed the FBI Citizens Academy.

In 2017, Trish Hanks was elected by multiple cities and school districts to serve on the Galveston County Appraisal District Board and after being elected to the city council, chose not to continue in that capacity when her two-year term expired. She continues to serve on several boards at the regional and state level while she works part-time as a field supervisor for candidates seeking certification as school Superintendents.

Trish Hanks is a professional coach and has special interests in strategic planning, team building and data analysis. She is a member of the Mary Queen Catholic church. Trish and her husband Bruce have two children and four young grandchildren.  Two of her grandchildren attend Friendswood schools.  Trish feels blessed to live in Friendswood and is grateful and honored to continue to have the opportunity to serve the community.  Trish enjoys her family, music, dancing, decorating, reading, traveling, and being with good company!

May 2024 - May 2027

* Friendswood Community Prayer Breakfast, Member
* Friendswood Chamber of Commerce, Member
* Bay Area Alliance Advisory Board, Member
* Friendswood Rotary Club, Paul Harris Fellow
* 2019 Dances with the Stars Champion
* Founding Member of the Friendswood Education Foundation
* Hospitality Ministry, Mary Queen

### City Council Committees

* Fourth of July Committee, Former Council Liaison

Individuals and organizations wishing to invite the Mayor or Councilmember(s) to an event or function are asked to submit the online request form.

You may
[email](mailto:citysecretary@ci.friendswood.tx.us)
your request, hand-deliver or mail your request to City Secretary's Office at 910 S. Friendswood Drive, Friendswood, Texas 77546-4856.

Please note that requests must be submitted two weeks in advance. The availability of elected officials is not guaranteed.
